It seems like more consideration has gone into the IMDb reviews of this film than went into the source.

Here's a review without pretensions, biased, subjectively negative, but not at all irrelevant to understanding what sort of film "Reposession Mambo" is. This isn't a bit highbrow "The Typewriter, the Rat or Civilization", hiding behind the gimmickry of a short limited budget film. This is an action film.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Tom and Jerry show up, and with a bit of help from the little funny men pay back Tom's callous use of them. Only one recent restoration for this title has survived thus far.
Title: Tom and Jerry - Snowbody Loves Me<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to me is that the picture was duplicated and dubbed in other languages, like in many Bollywood movies, without enough attention to the lip-synch with the background music.
An Academy Award. But deserves no less.

The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures across the galaxy in their space ships, along with their pets, the felines.
